title: wingen-vignette
text: middle earth example dataset contains three objects loaded ‘load_middle_earth_ex()’ [Add detail simulation ]
code: load_middle_earth_ex() ## ------------ middle earth loaded ------------- ##   ## Added to GlobalEnv:  ## vcf vcfR object with (1000 loci x 200 samples)  ## coords dataframe with x and y coordinates  ## lyr middle earth RasterLayer (100 x 100)  ##  ## ---------------------------------------------- ## # Genetic data vcf ## ***** Object of Class vcfR ***** ## 200 samples ## 1 CHROMs ## 1,000 variants ## Object size: 1.7 Mb ## 0 percent missing data ## *****        *****         ***** # Coordinates head(coords) ##             x          y ## 881 74.829415 -20.565023 ## 341 14.052468 -15.425978 ## 560  4.126699  -5.332612 ## 135 88.893018 -65.835666 ## 363 86.545357 -21.280152 ## 106 74.171030 -28.331393 # Raster data lyr ## class      : RasterLayer  ## dimensions : 100, 100, 10000  (nrow, ncol, ncell) ## resolution : 1, 1  (x, y) ## extent     : 0, 100, -100, 0  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) ## crs        : NA  ## source     : memory ## names      : layer  ## values     : 0, 1  (min, max) # Map of data plot(lyr, col = magma(100), axes = FALSE, box = FALSE) points(coords, col = mako(1, begin = 0.8), pch = 3, cex = 0.5)

title: wingen-vignette
code: wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "pi",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE,           nloci = 1000) ## Loading required namespace: adegenet plot_gd(wgd, main = "Window pi") plot_count(wgd, main = "Window sample counts")

title: wingen-vignette
code: kgd <- krig_gd(wgd, lyr, resample = FALSE) ## [using ordinary kriging] ## Warning in sqrt(krige_result$var1.var): NaNs produced ## [using ordinary kriging] ## Warning in sqrt(krige_result$var1.var): NaNs produced plot_gd(kgd, main = "Kriged pi") plot_count(kgd, main = "Kriged sample counts")

title: wingen-vignette
code: mgd <- mask_gd(kgd, min_n = 3)  plot_gd(mgd, main = "Kriged & masked pi")

title: wingen-vignette
code: system.time(wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "pi",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE,           nloci = 1000)) ## Loading required namespace: adegenet ##    user  system elapsed  ##   10.25    0.33   10.78 cores <- 5 cl <- makeCluster(cores) registerDoParallel(cl)  system.time( wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "pi",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE,           nloci = 1000,            parallel = TRUE) ) ##    user  system elapsed  ##    0.93    0.05   11.94 stopCluster(cl)

title: wingen-vignette
code: pi_wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "pi",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE,           nloci = 1000)  het_wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "het",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE)  AR_wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "biallelic.richness",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE) plot_gd(pi_wgd, main = "Pi") plot_gd(het_wgd, main = "Heterozygosity") plot_gd(AR_wgd, main = "Allelic Richness")

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bishop , Chambers , Wang (2022). wingen: Sliding Window Maps Genetic Diversity. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wingen: Sliding Window Maps of Genetic Diversity},   author = {Anusha Bishop and Anne Chambers and Ian Wang},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

what: Sliding Window Maps of Genetic Diversity
title: Sliding Window Maps of Genetic Diversity
text: Create maps genetic diversity using sliding window approach

title: Sliding Window Maps of Genetic Diversity
Sliding Window Maps of Genetic Diversity
code: library(wingen)  # load example middle earth data  ## vcf - biallelic SNP data (1000 loci x 100 individuals ## coords - coordinates of samples ## lyr - raster layer load_middle_earth_ex()  # Run sliding window calculations of pi with rarefaction wgd <- window_gd(vcf,           coords,           lyr,           stat = "pi",           fact = 3,           wdim = 5,           rarify = TRUE,           nloci = 1000)  # Krige results kgd <- krig_gd(wgd, lyr, disagg = 2)  # Mask results mgd <- mask_gd(kgd, min_n = 3)  # Plot results par(mfrow = c(1,3), oma = rep(2,4), mar = rep(2,4)) plot_gd(wgd, main = "Window pi") plot_gd(kgd, main = "Kriged pi") plot_gd(mgd, main = "Kriged & masked pi")

title: Raster interpolation using 'autoKrige' — krig_gd
text: r RasterLayer RasterStack grd object create grid kriging, can RasterLayer, SpatialPointsDataFrame, gridded object defined 'sp'. undefined, use r create grid. coords provided, kriging occur based values coordinates xy whether co-krige x y (~x+y) resample grd raster, whether resample r resolution grd (defaults FALSE) agg factor used aggregation grd provided disagg factor used disaggregation grd provided n_cell number cells interpolate across SpatialPointsDataFrame provided grd

code: load_mini_ex() #> -------- mini middle earth loaded --------- #>   #> Added to GlobalEnv:  #> vcf vcfR object with (10 loci x 10 samples)  #> coords dataframe with x and y coordinates  #> lyr middle earth RasterLayer (10 x 10)  #>  #> ------------------------------------------- #>  wpi <- window_gd(vcf, coords, lyr, stat = "pi", nloci = 10, rarify_n = 4, rarify_nit = 5, rarify = TRUE) #> Loading required namespace: adegenet #> Loading required package: raster #> Warning: package 'raster' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Loading required package: sp #> Warning: package 'sp' was built under R version 4.1.3 #> Error: package or namespace load failed for 'raster' in .doLoadActions(where, attach): #>  error in load action .__A__.1 for package terra: loadModule(module = "spat", what = TRUE, env = ns, loadNow = TRUE): Unable to load module "spat": object of type 'closure' is not subsettable #> Error in .requirePackage(package): unable to find required package 'raster' kpi <- krig_gd(wpi, lyr) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'as.list': object 'wpi' not found plot_gd(kpi) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'plot': object 'kpi' not found plot_count(kpi) #> Error in h(simpleError(msg, call)): error in evaluating the argument 'x' in selecting a method for function 'plot': object 'kpi' not found

title: Helper function to rarify subsample and calculate genetic diversity — rarify_gd
code: rarify_gd(gen, sub, rarify_nit = 10, rarify_n = 4, stat, fun, nloci = NULL)

title: Helper function to rarify subsample and calculate genetic diversity — rarify_gd
text: gen genetic data (note: order matters! coordinate genetic data order, currently checks .) rarify_nit rarify = TRUE, number iterations use rarefaction rarify_n rarify = TRUE, number points use rarefaction fun function use summarize data window (defaults base R mean) nloci calculating pi, nloci=NULL (default), returns sum SNPs nucleotide diversity; otherwise return average nucleotide diversity per nucleotide given length nloci sequence (L argument pi.dosage function)

title: Rarefaction helper function — rarify_helper
Rarefaction helper function — rarify_helper
code: rarify_helper(gen, sub, rarify_n, rarify_nit, stat, fun = mean, nloci = NULL)

title: Rarefaction helper function — rarify_helper
text: gen genetic data (note: order matters! coordinate genetic data order, currently checks .) rarify_n rarify = TRUE, number points use rarefaction rarify_nit rarify = TRUE, number iterations use rarefaction fun function use summarize data window (defaults base R mean) nloci calculating pi, nloci=NULL (default), returns sum SNPs nucleotide diversity; otherwise return average nucleotide diversity per nucleotide given length nloci sequence (L argument pi.dosage function)

Sliding window allelic richness — window_ar
code: window_ar(   ar_df,   coords,   lyr,   fact = 0,   wdim = 10,   rarify = FALSE,   rarify_n = 4,   rarify_nit = 10,   min_n = 2,   fun = mean,   plot_its = FALSE,   plot_its_steps = 1 )

title: Sliding window allelic richness — window_ar
text: ar_df dataframe allelic richness (note: rows loci, columns individuals) coords coordinates (two columns, first x second y order ar_df), lyr RasterLayer slide window across fact aggregation factor apply RasterLayer (reduces computational time) wdim dimensions (height x width) window, one value provided square window created rarify whether use rarefaction calculations rarify_n rarify = TRUE, number points use rarefaction rarify_nit rarify = TRUE, number iterations use rarefaction min_n min number samples calculate allelic richness (equal rarify_n provided, otherwise defaults 2) fun function use summarize data window (defaults mean) plot_its whether produce plot every plot_its_steps iterations show progress plot_its_steps plot iteration plot_its true

title: Sliding window allelic richness — window_ar
text: RasterStack includes raster allelic richness raster number samples used calculation allelic richness cell

code: window_gd(   vcf,   coords,   lyr,   stat = "pi",   fact = 0,   wdim = 5,   rarify = FALSE,   rarify_n = 4,   rarify_nit = 5,   min_n = 2,   fun = mean,   parallel = FALSE,   nloci = NULL )

title: Sliding window map of genetic diversity — window_gd
text: vcf object type vcf ( (note: order matters! coordinate genetic data order, currently checks .)) coords coordinates (two columns, first x second y order genetic data), lyr RasterLayer slide window across stat genetic diversity stat calculate (can either "pi" nucleotide diversity, "het" average heterozygosity across loci, "allelic.richness" average allelic richness across loci, "biallelic.richness" get average allelic richness across loci biallelic dataset (option faster "allelic.richness")) fact aggregation factor apply RasterLayer (note: increasing value reduces computational time) wdim dimensions (height x width) window, one value provided square window created rarify rarify = TRUE, rarefaction performed rarify_n rarify = TRUE, number points use rarefaction rarify_nit rarify = TRUE, number iterations use rarefaction min_n min number samples calculate allelic richness (equal rarify_n provided, otherwise defaults 2) fun function use summarize data window (defaults base R mean) parallel whether parallelize function (see vignette setting cluster ) nloci calculating pi, nloci=NULL (default), returns sum SNPs nucleotide diversity; otherwise return average nucleotide diversity per nucleotide given length nloci sequence (L argument pi.dosage function)

title: Sliding window map of genetic diversity — window_gd
text: RasterStack includes raster genetic diversity raster number samples within window cell

title: Sliding window map of genetic diversity — window_gd
code: load_mini_ex() #> -------- mini middle earth loaded --------- #>   #> Added to GlobalEnv:  #> vcf vcfR object with (10 loci x 10 samples)  #> coords dataframe with x and y coordinates  #> lyr middle earth RasterLayer (10 x 10)  #>  #> ------------------------------------------- #>  wpi <- window_gd(vcf, coords, lyr, stat = "pi", nloci = 10, rarify_n = 4, rarify_nit = 5, rarify = TRUE) whet <- window_gd(vcf, coords, lyr, stat = "het", nloci = 10, rarify_n = 4, rarify_nit = 5, rarify = TRUE) war <- window_gd(vcf, coords, lyr, stat = "biallelic.richness", nloci = 10, rarify_n = 4, rarify_nit = 5, rarify = TRUE) plot_gd(wpi)  plot_gd(whet)  plot_gd(war)  plot_count(wpi)
